subject: Climate & Environment
title: Virtual Water Trade
description: A quick win: understand Virtual Water Trade.

hook.text: That morning cup of coffee took 140 liters of water to produce. You just can't see it.

buildup.text: Virtual water is the hidden water used to grow, process, and transport the goods we buy.

discovery.text: When a dry country imports wheat, it is effectively importing the water used to grow it.

twist.text: Water-rich countries export virtual water without realizing they are depleting their own reserves.

climax.text: Tracking virtual water reveals the true cost of global trade on freshwater systems.

punchline.text: Every product has a hidden water bill. We just never see it.

quiz.question: What is 'virtual water'?
options: The hidden water used to produce goods
